data.title: GDX Setup Is Blank
data.body:
I used libGDX 1.3.1 in previous projects of mine, and it did not have the problem that follows. When I open the gdx-setup.jar file for the newer version of libGDX (v1.4.1) I get this: [[YouTube link](http://youtu.be/pfxU73QhMuo)]. Could this have anything to do with my using openjdk instead of Oracle? I tested this on openjdk 6 and 7, and it had the same results on both. I also tried compiling myself from the source-code but I got the same thing (which makes me doubt that it's openjdk if I compiled it with openjdk).

I'm currently running Debian 8 (Jessie).

Thanks a ton!

data.title: Add protected Mesh constructor and move invalidate to VertexData
data.body:
Adds a protected constructor to Mesh, which allows the user to specify a custom VertexData and IndexData implementation. Made it protected instead of public, because imo most users should not have to care about this and if they do then extending the Mesh class shouldn't be a problem.

Also moved the invalidate() method to the VertexData interface, instead of the instanceof check. Mesh shouldn't be aware of the VertexData implementation. E.g. VertexBufferObjectSubData does also have a invalidate() method implementation.

data.title: Fixing Bits - more considerate about set bits.
data.body:
The current Bits implementation doesn't cope well when the backing array differs in length. This affects:
- **hashcode/equals:** hashcode and equality should only consider set bits.
- **bitwise operations, except andNot():** only performs the operation up to the length of the shortest array.

data.title: Enforce continuous rendering while pausing Android backends
data.body:
Backends takes care to setContinuousRendering(true) before calling AndroidGraphics#pause() in their #onPause() method. The problem is that the #onPause() method of the backends are called from the Android UI Thread so a call to AndroidGraphics#onDrawFrame(GL10) may occur (on the GLThread) between those calls :
-  graphics.setContinuousRendering(true)
-  graphics.pause();

AndroidGraphics#onDrawFrame(GL10) may call the ApplicationListener#render() method in the meantime that could set continuous rendering to false as discussed in #2461 

Thus very unlikely, it might appen if the GLThread has the lock on the AndroidGraphics#synch var in the onDrawFrame(GL10) while the UI Thread wait for it in the pause() method... Then the pause() method will set the AndroidGraphics#pause var to true which will never get back to false (it get false in onDrawFrame(GL10) which will never be called as we switch to non continuous rendering...)

hope i'm clear ;-)

data.title: Fix for setContinuousRendering(false) in iOS backend
data.body: Fix for non-continuous rendering in GLKViewController by pausing/unpausing the render thread instead of calling setNeedsDisplay().

data.title: MediaPlayer$EventHandler.handleMessage NPE

Today happened twice on Nexus 5 and Nexus 7 2013 probably when stopped and disposed sounds/music

``` java
java.lang.NullPointerException
at android.media.MediaPlayer$EventHandler.handleMessage(MediaPlayer.java:2218)
at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136)
at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5001)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515)
at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:785)

```

data.title: fixing BoundingBox mul
data.body:
multiplication on bounding box must be set to inf() before using ext().
because a transformation like a translation is not an extension of the bounding box, so ext() is not valid in this case.
boundingbox must be reset with inf() first.

fix now seems to work :)

data.title: Json fromJson convert number to string field
Small improvements for Gdx.Net (HTTP)
data.body:
I've added a few things to the HTTP part of `Gdx.Net`.
- Added OPTIONS, HEAD, TRACE and CONNECT to the `HttpMethods`
- Added a `HttpResponseHeader` interface with constants for HTTP (response) headers
- Added a `HttpRequestHeader` interface with constants for HTTP (request) headers
- Made `HttpRequest` poolable.

Infinite loop in AssetManager.java for FreetypeFontLoader Asset
Adding one action to an actor on a table
data.body:
Hi,
it seems some strange behaviour here. This snippet works perfectly:

```
    btnBack = new Button(skinGameOver, "back");
btnBack.addAction(sequence(delay(2.0f),moveBy(10,10)));
layer.add(btnBack)
```

I can see the action. But in case I want just one action like this:

```
    btnBack = new Button(skinGameOver, "back");
btnBack.addAction(moveBy(10,10));
layer.add(btnBack)
```

it doesn't work.

data.title: Group Size Issue
data.body: I have a simple group with 2 imagebutton inside. The problem is that I can not set the image  of the imagebutton to the size I want. For example, the original size of the  image of the imagebutton is 40_40. Then I can only change the image to some size that has the same aspect ratio as the original one like 50 \* 50 or 60 \* 60.Its not possible to set it to 40 \* 50 or 50 \* 80. If I set a size with a different aspect ratio, it just produces blanket space around according to the specific ratio.For instance, if I set it to 40_50,then it will produce 10 pixels space vertically while not change the width. In addition, I have experienced this problem with table as well. My libgdx version is 1.3.1 which seems like the newest one.Really appreciate some advice to help me out this headache.

data.title: Fixed Android 4.4+ external storage behavior
data.body:
Closes #2426 

What this PR does:
- Switches reading and writing by default to the new external storage APIs which creates an application-specific directory on the sd card.
- Falls back to legacy root of sdcard if file exists there.
- Hides these changes from the developer, it is all done under-the-hood.

Tested with FilesTest in gdx-tests
- Nexus 7 (2013) running Android L Developer Preview [tested with legacy + forced new behavior]
- Blu Advance 4.5 4G running Android 4.2.2 [tested with legacy + forced new behavior]

This PR does compile, I check that. :)

data.title: Fix getCenter(out)
data.body: Fix public Vector3 getCenter (Vector3 out) to actually update the out parameter

data.title: GWT: Missing method-stub 5473 for method HashMap
data.body:
When trying to read a JSON file from a particular class with fromJson(), the GWT app throws a "Missing method-stub 5473 for method HashMap" exception. The class in question contains a single HashMap<String,Object> where Object is a complex class.

Looking in the reflection cache, I see that an entry for the HashMap constructor id'ed with 5473 is present but it does not appear in a switch statement.

(FWIW I'm using gdx.reflect.include to contain quite a few classes. A couple have inner classes that throw com.google.gwt.core.ext.typeinfo.NotFoundException but I'm not using them for reflection)

Using libGDX 1.4.1, GWT 2.6.0.

data.title: Fix iOS dirty <-> continuous rendering switch not working
data.body: As discussed in #2419

data.title: relax Affine2Test tolerance
data.body:
Fixes #2451. 

This raises the question, should the look-up table be used consistently in the library? It's quicker: 5-6x on my desktop (Core i5 3570K) and ~6.5x on a Krait 400. But a less precise Matrix is likely to break 3rd party code.

data.title: Make it so demos update their Gradle stuff automatically on each build
data.body: Most are currently building against libGDX 1.0. Could probably just whip up a fancy shell script that pulls in the gradle files from master and replaces the one in the demo's repository.

data.title: Affine2Test fails
data.body:
I've been playing with the tests and just realised that https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/tests/gdx-tests/src/com/badlogic/gdx/tests/Affine2Test.java
fails with the following exception:

``` java
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: matrices are not equal
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tests.Affine2Test.check(Affine2Test.java:128)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tests.Affine2Test.checkEqual(Affine2Test.java:141)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tests.Affine2Test.checkEqual(Affine2Test.java:132)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.tests.Affine2Test.create(Affine2Test.java:63)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:136)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:114)
```

Tested via LwjglTestStarter.java.

I'm guessing that the commit to blame is this one: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/61729f4f36dcc0e32e78894fbdab55bb6ea9edea
Maybe @vmilea knows what happened ?

data.title: JSON improvements: #toString and #name()
Update text while drawing BitmapFont make text "broken" (not smooth anymoar)
data.body:
Hi guys.

I use this code to load BitmapFont:

```
FreeTypeFontLoaderParameter loadingParams = new FreeTypeFontLoaderParameter();
loadingParams.fontFileName = "fonts/segoeui.ttf";
loadingParams.fontParameters.size = 48;
Assets.inst().load("loading.ttf", BitmapFont.class, loadingParams);
```

After that, i render it by this:

```
TextBounds tb = Assets.inst().get("loading.ttf", BitmapFont.class).getBounds(message);
Assets.inst().get("loading.ttf", BitmapFont.class).draw(Global.sprite_batch, message, Global.screenW / 2 - tb.width / 2, 100);
```

In the begening, `message` = "Loading..." and everything is ok. But after few second, when I change `message` to "Tap to continue", the text is "broken".

Here are examples:

Normal:
![normal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5146176/4587626/ee20bad0-502f-11e4-8f74-ef689888bccb.png)

Abnormal:
![ab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5146176/4587627/f0041612-502f-11e4-9737-5661f850563f.png)

I tested it on Android and Desktop.

I dont know if it is an issue to post it here, cause I cant find anything related to this problem (actually, I dont know English keyword to search about it).

data.title: Android keyboard input type fix
data.body:
On some devices (as my HTC One X plus running Android 4.2.2), the default keyboard that is used in libGDX always uses the input type that was last used. This means when you run some application that uses a digit-only keyboard, then exit that application and start the libGDX application directly, a digit-only keyboard will show up when trying to write into an InputField.
This fix uses an old way to handle keyboard input that was already built into libGDX, but never used. It just uses a hidden TextView element with the input type TEXT. The key inputs are then routed to the AndroidInput as usual.

Second commit is about password mode of TextFields. If the font of a text field does not contain the defined (or default) password character, it will currently just write plain text. There is no error or log message and could therefore be confusing, as it was for me. I suggest throwing an exception in that case.
